column2: IOWA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Green and white signs:
column4: give information about directions and distances.
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: direct drivers to services.
column10: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.

column2: 2. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 3. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column8: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column10: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column8: No U-turns
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 5. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column6: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column8: delay near it.
column10: cut abruptly in front of it.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Look both ways before crossing the intersection
column8: Yield

column2: 7. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 8. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column8: darker

column2: 9. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column6: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column8: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column10: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column2: 10. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column8: Parking is not allowed.

column2: 12. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column8: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column10: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column2: 13. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column8: of two-way traffic

column2: 14. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: straight down the middle of the road.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: towards the left side of the road.
column10: towards the right side of the road.

column2: 15. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 16. Drivers should change lanes:
column8: often.

column2: 17. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column10: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.

column2: 18. Passing is prohibited:
column6: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column8: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column8: Two way right turn

column2: 20. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 21. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column6: It is not recommended to check
column8: Never use

column2: 22. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column8: Shift workers.

column2: 23. Vehicles stopped behind a school bus when the red lights are flashing must remain stopped until:
column4: all students are off the bus.
column8: the stop arm is retracted and the bus begins moving.

column2: 24. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: the speed limit is increased at night.
column6: vehicle speed and distance are harder to judge.
column8: there are more cars on the roads at night.

column2: 25. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive with the flow of traffic.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column8: Wrong Way

column2: 27. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column8: road rage

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column8: Playground warning

column2: 29. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column6: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column8: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column10: only if you have an emergency.

column2: 30. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light
column8: finish crossing the street.

column2: 31. When you approach this sign, you must:
column8: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 32. This sign indicates:
column8: a side road.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column6: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column8: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column10: Always come to a complete stop

column2: 34. You should increase your following distance when:
column8: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 35. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver who does not control the car.
column8: No one.
